intro: Neotorularia humilis f. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered form of the species, is a rare and delicate plant characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit. It features delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle ornamental value. The plant is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
